cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles south of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest along the west coast of Florida, then curving north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend and inland across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area near Steinhatchee/Cedar Key)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Egmont Key to the Steinhatchee River, Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to Ochlockonee River, including Tampa Bay (Tropical Storm and Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida including Tampa Bay and the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with gusts possibly reaching near-hurricane strength (around 70 mph) Tuesday night into early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground level possible in Tampa Bay and adjacent Gulf coasts.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized totals up to 8 inches, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents affecting vessel operations.
